result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Jaeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release if revoked.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge, plus a 5% surcharge of $23.28 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. 

No drug paraphernalia.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Must complete assessment as soon as possible, must enroll within 60 days.

10:00 AM Defendant Robert R Jaeger in court, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Robert R Jaeger.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. On count 2- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Counts 1 and 3 DRI on state's motion.  Counsel stipulates to 2 days credit. 

SENTENCE: Imp/stayed 1 year jail. 1 year probation. AODA and comply, enroll within 60 days. No drugs without a prescription. No drug para. $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 5% surcharge to COCC.60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Must report to probation. 2 days credit. 10:13 am adj. *Subj to GT and WR if revoked.
